item.description:
Join us for another FREE classical music concert at the New England Conservatory of Music!

Tonight, the NEC welcomes Yan Pascal Tortelier, Principal Conductor of Sao Paulo Symphony Orchestra, as guest conductor of the Philharmonia. Works by Ravel, Prokofiev and Morton Gould will be performed.

For more information about this concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/philharmonia-tortelier.

 

 Let's meet up at 7:30pm, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert.  If the balcony is open, we will sit in left-middle section of it, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra and the pianist's hands, is open to the ceiling, is easy to describe and find, and it is relatively easy to grab a large block of seats there.  If the balcony is closed, I will try to have the group sit in the 1st two rows of seats at the back of the floor section, just past the overhang and in front of the black cloth-covered sound equipment.

Note: Due to Meetup's terrible decision to remove the Maybe option (write to Meetup here if you want to register your displeasure with that!), please indicate whether you are a Maybe in your Yes RSVP, and try to update your RSVP if you're not coming. 

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.

This evening's program will include:

  • Ravel: Rapsodie espagnole                                   (listen to the first part here)
  • Prokofiev: Piano Concerto No.2, op.16, G minor   (listen to the andantino here)
         (student soloist to be announced)
  • Morton Gould: Spirituals                                     (listen to a bit here)
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group upstairs in the left-middle balcony section if its open, or in the back center floor section if it's not.
item.name: NEC Classical Concert Series: Tortelier conducts Ravel, Prokofiev, & Gould
